title: 10/24/2023 - Senate Study Committee on Rural Medical Personnel Recruitment
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia 10/24/2023 - Senate Study Committee on Rural Medical Personnel Recruitment session:

## Overview
The session focused on discussing recommendations and strategies to address the ongoing challenges of ensuring access to healthcare services for citizens living in rural and underserved areas in Georgia. The discussion highlighted the importance of a team-based approach to healthcare delivery, leveraging state-level legislation and funding, as well as advocating for federal programs to increase the supply of healthcare providers.

## Key Actions
No specific bills were passed or referred during this session.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
No new bills were introduced during this session.

## Notable Moments
- The chair emphasized the need for legislators to be "super intentional advocates" for Georgia residents with the Georgia congressional delegation, as some of the proposed programs require federal-level action.
- Examples were provided of successful programs at Andrew College and Wiregrass Georgia Technical College that aim to recruit and train healthcare professionals, particularly from rural areas, with the goal of retaining them in their local communities.
- The chair of the Department of Family Medicine and Community Medicine at the Medical College of Georgia provided an overview of their efforts to train and place more healthcare professionals in rural areas.

## Votes
No recorded votes were taken during this session.

## Attendance
The session maintained a quorum, with legislators and other stakeholders present.

## Adjournment
The session adjourned. No information was provided on the next scheduled meeting.
